message_1: Find the points on the elliptic curve y^2 = x^3 + 10x + 8 over the finite field GF(13).
message_2:
To find the points on the elliptic curve y^2 = x^3 + 10x + 8 over the finite field GF(13), we will iterate through all possible x and y values in the field and check if they satisfy the equation. The finite field GF(13) has 13 elements: {0, 1, 2, ..., 12}. 

We will use the equation y^2 = x^3 + 10x + 8 (mod 13) and check for each (x, y) pair if it holds true.

Here are the points on the elliptic curve:

(0, 5), (0, 8)
(1, 1), (1, 12)
(2, 3), (2, 10)
(3, 4), (3, 9)
(4, 2), (4, 11)
(5, 0)
(6, 6), (6, 7)
(7, 3), (7, 10)
(8, 5), (8, 8)
(9, 1), (9, 12)
(10, 6), (10, 7)
(11, 4), (11, 9)
(12, 2), (12, 11)

There are a total of 19 points on the elliptic curve y^2 = x^3 + 10x + 8 over the finite field GF(13).
